Spiro Agnew, this man's vice president, resigned after a corruption investigation and was replaced by Gerald Ford. Name this president who resigned after an investigation about a break-in at the Watergate Hotel.

In this novel, Syme is an editor who disappears from work, and Mr Charrington struggles to remember the words to "Oranges and Lemons." O'Brien pretends to be in the Brotherhood in this novel, but is later revealed to be a member of the Thought Police and sends Julia and Winston to be tortured in the Ministry of Love. Name this George Orwell novel about a dystopian society run by the mysterious Big Brother.

A federal judge blocked a merger between Albertsons and this grocery chain. Albertsons then pulled out of the deal and sued this grocer. The company, the largest supermarket chain in the United States by revenue, operates over 2,700 stores in 35 states. It is headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, and its history traces back to 1883 when Barney Kroger invested his life savings to open a grocery store in downtown Cincinnati. What is the name of this supermarket giant, known for its customer loyalty programs and its "Our Brands" product line?

The two-way sensation Travis Hunter recently took home this prestigious college football award. This award, whose first recipient was Jay Berwanger from the University of Chicago in 1935, is given annually to the most outstanding player in college football.  The trophy's distinctive pose, with a player stiff-arming a defender, was inspired by Ed Smith, a former New York University player who modeled for the trophy's sculptor.  The award ceremony is held in New York City, and the winner is chosen by a nationwide panel of sports journalists and former winners.  What is the name of this prestigious award, considered the highest individual honor in college football?

This post-apocalyptic action-adventure game, set 20 years after a fungal pandemic has ravaged the world, features a hardened smuggler named Joel who is tasked with escorting a teenage girl named Ellie across a desolate United States.  The game's emotional narrative and realistic graphics, powered by the PlayStation 3's capabilities, created a cinematic and immersive experience.  Its sequel, released in 2020, continued the story and explored themes of revenge, forgiveness, and the enduring bonds of love and loyalty.  What is the name of this critically acclaimed game, which was turned into an HBO Mini Series?

This band's debut album, recorded entirely by Dave Grohl in 1995, was a cathartic response to the tragic death of Kurt Cobain and the dissolution of Nirvana. Their music video for "Learn to Fly," featuring the band members as wacky airline employees, won a Grammy Award for Best Short Form Music Video. They have been inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, solidifying their status as one of the most influential rock bands of the 21st century. What is the name of this band, whose current lineup includes members like Nate Mendel, Chris Shiflett, and Taylor Hawkins' successor, Josh Freese?

This hockey player, known for his powerful one-timer shot and his exuberant goal celebrations, surpassed Gordie Howe in 2022 to become the NHL's second all-time leading goal scorer. He was drafted first overall by the Washington Capitals in the 2004 NHL Entry Draft and has become the face of the franchise. He led the Capitals to their first Stanley Cup victory in 2018, cementing his legacy as one of the greatest goal scorers in NHL history. Who is this Russian hockey superstar, nicknamed "The Great Eight"?

In fluid dynamics, streamlines are vectors instantaneously tangent to those of this quantity. When drag and buoyant forces are equal to gravity, an object experiences the "terminal" variety of this quantity. The amount of this quantity required to overcome the force of gravity is known as the "escape" variety. The rate of change of this quantity is acceleration. Name this quantity often expressed as a speed combined with a direction.

One theory about this event claims that participants like Mary Walcott were poisoned by ergot fungi in their rye. During this event, Giles Corey was killed by having heavy stones piled on him because he refused to plead either guilty or innocent. Cotton Mather defended the use of "spectral evidence," based on visions, during this event, in which nineteen people were hanged. Name this 1690s hysteria in Massachusetts in which people were accused of sorcery.

Time Magazine recently named this man their "Person of the Year". This man made history this year by being the first person since Grover Cleveland to win non-consecutive presidential elections. Name this real estate developer turned politician who is known for this Mar-a-Lago club in Florida.

John Conroy developed the Kensington System to guide this leader's upbringing. This monarch was rumored to be secretly married to her servant John Brown. This last British monarch from the House of Hanover was succeeded by her son Edward VII. She was given the title Empress of India by Benjamin Disraeli. This monarch's popularity plummeted drastically after a self-imposed isolation after the death of her mother and her husband, Prince Albert. Name this Queen of England from 1837 to 1901.

In one story from this work, a crew of explorers discovers a city of brass filled with wealth, but where all the inhabitants have died from a famine. Antoine Galland added a story to this work in which a character meets snakes who can swallow elephants, and that sailor is transported from a valley of diamonds by a giant bird called a roc. In addition to Sinbad the Sailor, other stories in this collection include Ali Baba and the Forty Thieves and Aladdin. Name this collection of Middle Eastern folk tales told by Scheherazade over the title number of nights.

The Bahr Yussef canal once connected this river to Lake Moeris, and one feeder to it is the Kagera River. Towards the end of this river's path, it splits into two distributaries, the Rosetta Branch, and the Damietta Branch. One tributary of this river begins in Lake Tana, while the other begins in Lake Victoria. It flows over six cataracts, and its Blue and White Branches meet in the Sudanese city of Khartoum. Identify this African river that flows through eleven countries, the longest river in the world.

This skiier recently returned from her 2019 retirement. This athlete, the most successful American woman in alpine skiing history, holds the record for the most World Cup wins by a female skier with 82 victories.  She overcame numerous injuries throughout her career, including a devastating crash at the 2013 World Championships that nearly ended her career.  She won three Olympic medals, including a gold in downhill at the 2010 Vancouver Games.  She is also known for her high-profile relationship with golfer Tiger Woods. Name this alpine skiing legend.

At age 18, Gukesh Dommaraju recently became the youngest world champion of this game. This game, whose earliest predecessor is believed to be chaturanga, which originated in India before the 6th century CE, features pieces with names derived from Persian words, such as "shah" for king and "rukh" for chariot.  The longest recorded game, "The Evergreen Game" played in 1852, lasted 20 hours and 15 minutes and ended in a draw after 147 moves.  Its modern form evolved in Europe during the 15th century, with standardized rules and the introduction of the powerful queen piece. Name this strategic board game.

This region contains the two-hundred-foot-tall Obsidian Cliff near the Mammoth-Norris section of its Grand Loop. Mats of heat-seeking bacteria cause the bright colors of this park's Morning Glory Pool and Grand Prismatic hot spring. A feature in this park, named Steamboat, is the world's largest active geyser, and releases steam heated in the caldera of this park's namesake super-volcano. Name this national park, mostly in Wyoming, known for the regular eruptions of Old Faithful.

This event may have happened to make room for the Domus Aurea. This event was blamed on early Christians, leading to their 64 CE persecution. According to Tacitus, this event began near the Palatine Hill while the emperor was in Antium. Name this disaster that destroyed a prosperous Italian city, legendarily while Nero either played a lyre or fiddled.
incorrect3: Fall of the Western Roman Empire

question: One work by this composer includes a "limping waltz" and a dynamic marking of 6 p's for the bassoon; that sixth symphony was premiered just a week before this man's death. A popular work by this composer of the Pathetique symphony quotes the French national anthem and includes cannonfire in its depiction of Napoleon's failed invasion. Name this Russian composer of the 1812 Overture.

This coming-of-age film, set during a Saturday detention session, features students from different cliques who learn to connect.  The film's iconic ending, with the characters raising their fists in triumph as Simple Minds' "Don't You (Forget About Me)" plays, has become a symbol of teenage rebellion and self-discovery.  The film's cast, including Emilio Estevez, Anthony Michael Hall, Judd Nelson, Molly Ringwald, and Ally Sheedy, became known as the "Brat Pack" and represented a generation of young actors in 1980s films.  What is the title of this 1985 film directed by John Hughes?

This man exclaimed, "so I come here tonight to go to bed" in a 2:00 AM speech at the University of Michigan that introduced the idea of the Peace Corps. This man asked, "why does Rice play Texas?" to illustrate that "we choose to go to the Moon in this decade" because it is difficult. This man defeated a fatigued-looking Richard Nixon in the first televised presidential debate. Name this president who commanded, "ask what you can do for your country" during his 1961 inauguration.

German thinkers in this field like Kurt Koffka promoted a Gestalt approach to it. The "individual"approach to this field of study was pioneered by a man whose observations of siblings led him to coin the term "inferiority complex." Scientists in this field may use the MBTI questionnaire, which analyzes introversion and extraversion. Alfred Adler and Carl Jung studied what science of the mind, personality, and behavior?

One organ in members of this phylum contains many ommatidium. Some members of this phylum have an excretory system consisting of Malphigian tubules, while others have book lungs in their respiratory system. Extinct members of this phylum include trilobites, and many members of this phylum have their body divided among the head, thorax, and abdomen. Members of this phylum shed their exoskeleton and have jointed legs. Name this animal phylum which contains crustaceans, arachnids, and insects.

At one battle in this war, John of Bohemia fought even though he was blind. A temporary peace during this war was the Treaty of Bretigny. This conflict saw a battle on St. Crispin's Day that was the subject of the speech about "ye band of brothers." Joan of Arc was captured and burnt at the stake during this war. The Battles of Crecy and Agincourt were fought during what war between the English and French from 1337 to 1453?

This country's Dodecanese island group actually consists of fifteen islands. In ancient times, ships were dragged over an isthmus in this country using a road called the Diolkos. Many migrants to Europe try to reach this country's islands of Kos and Lesbos. Rhodes and Crete are islands in this country, whose capital contains the Parthenon. What country is led from Athens?

This basketball player, known for his smooth scoring ability and clutch performances, led Duke University to the NCAA tournament as a freshman before being drafted third overall by the Boston Celtics in 2017. He earned the Eastern Conference Finals MVP award in 2022, leading the Celtics to the NBA Finals. He won his first title in 2024. He is a five-time NBA All-Star and has been named to the All-NBA First Team thrice. Name this star of of the Boston Celtics.

One character in this novel is sent to Dr. Dorian after her mother believes she is insane. Templeton searches for inspiration for one character in this novel, whose children include Joy, Nellie, and Aranea. The words "Humble", "Terrific", and "Radiant" are written to prevent a character in this novel from being killed by Mr. Zuckerman. Name this novel by E.B. White, in which the title spider saves the life of Wilbur.

This comedy series, known for its improvisational style and cringeworthy humor, features a semi-fictionalized version of its creator and star, Larry David, as he navigates social situations with his signature neurotic and often inappropriate behavior. The show's "no hugging, no learning" rule, established by Larry, reflects his aversion to physical affection and his resistance to personal growth. What is the name of this HBO series, which has been praised for its sharp wit and satirical take on social norms?

This man recently fled to Moscow after rebels took control of the Damascus, Syria. His father was the president of Syria from 1971-2000. This man then took his father's office in 2000 and served in the role until he was forced to flee by rebel forces. Name this son of Hafez al-Assad who has been accused of war crimes during the Syrian Civil War.

An embargo on this commodity caused the so-called "Lancashire Famine." The Petit Gulf hybrid of this crop dramatically increased its production, which grew after a land rush called the Alabama Fever. A 1856 speech by James Henry Hammond said that "no power on the earth dared to make war on" this good and that this good "is King." The spread of the boll weevil caused a crisis for growers of this crop. An invention of Eli Whitney sped up the processing of this crop. Name this crop for which the invention of its namesake "gin," a seed separator, entrenched slavery in the South.

This philosopher called himself a "free spirit" and argued his predecessors were morally prejudiced in one work. He divided an art form into Apollonian and Dionysian types in another work. This philosopher wrote of his "horrification" of the idea of eternal recurrence and argued that the main impetus behind behavior is the "will to power." This author of The Birth of Tragedy believed humans were part of the evolution of the ubermensch. Name this German author of Thus Spoke Zarathustra, who wrote "God is dead" in The Gay Science.

To the west of this mountain range lies the Pechora basin, which includes the Illych and Usa rivers, and to its east lies the Ob basin. This mountain range rises from the Kara Sea in the north, and its nether-polar region contains its highest peaks, including Mount Karpinsky, and the highest peak of this mountain range, Mount Narodnaya. During World War II, the Soviet authority moved many factories to its foothills, which have long been regarded as the major mineral base of Russia. Identify this mountain range that is considered the natural boundary between northern Asia and Europe.

This tennis player, became the youngest ATP 500 champion in history when he won the 2021 Citi Open in Washington, D.C. at the age of 19.  He is the first player born in the 2000s to reach the quarterfinals of all four Grand Slam tournaments. He is also an accomplished skier, having won a national championship in giant slalom at the age of 13 before focusing on tennis. He tested positive for performance enhancing drugs in 2024 but was cleared. Name this rising Italian tennis star who won 2 Grand Slam titles in 2024.

Projects Blue Book, Sign, and Grudge were studies of these things conducted by the U.S. Air Force. A supposed discovery of one of these things in Roswell, New Mexico was passed off as a weather balloon by the military. These objects that supposedly make crop circles are rumored to be studied at Area 51. Name these unexplainable aerial phenomena often attributed to alien activity and described as flying saucers.

This author wrote about a man who refuses grapes from Merecdes; that character seeks revenge on Fernand, Danglars and Villefort using a fortune found in prison. Another novel by this man describes the machinations of Cardinal Richeliu; at the end of that novel a commission is refused by Porthos, Athos, and Aramis. Edmond Dantes and d'Artagnan were created by what French author of The Count of Monte Cristo and The Three Musketeers?

RAID arrays are combinations of these objects that often connect via IDE or Serial ATA. They are sometimes replaced by SSDs and can be structured using NTFS or FAT. These objects contain spinning platters that use magnetism to store data, so the data is retained even when they are powered off. Name these devices with capacities often in the terabytes, used to store computer data.

This anthology series explores the dark side of technology and its impact on society. One episode depicts a dystopian world where people rate each other in real-time, creating a social hierarchy based on scores. Its creator envisioned it as a modern-day "Twilight Zone," tackling themes of social media, artificial intelligence, and virtual reality. What is the name of this Netflix series, known for its unsettling and thought-provoking stories?

Christopher Wray announced he would step down as the leader of this agency at the beginning of 2025. This agency's Ten Most Wanted Fugitives list, established in 1950, has featured notorious criminals like Osama bin Laden and Ted Bundy. Its headquarters, the J. Edgar Hoover Building in Washington, D.C., is named after its first director, who led the agency for 48 years. It is responsible for investigating federal crimes, including terrorism, cybercrime, and organized crime. What is the name of this federal law enforcement agency?

This artist recently completed her record-breaking "Eras Tour" which kicked off in March 2024. The tour featured a setlist spanning her entire music catalog, from her country beginnings to her pop anthems. The tour's elaborate stage design, costume changes, and surprise acoustic songs have delighted fans and critics alike. It has become the highest-grossing tour of all time by a female artist, surpassing Madonna's "Sticky & Sweet Tour." The tour's opening night in Glendale, Arizona, led the city to temporarily rename itself "Swift City" in honor of the event. Who is this singer-songwriter?

This long-running video game franchise, known for its open-world environments and controversial content, allows players to explore fictional cities like Liberty City, Vice City, and San Andreas, inspired by real-world locations.  The series has sparked debate and criticism for its depiction of violence, crime, and mature themes.  Its latest installment, released in 2013, became one of the best-selling video games of all time, generating over $8 billion in revenue.  What is the name of this controversial yet popular franchise, developed by Rockstar Games?

Adrian Smith designed the world's largest structure of this type, which is currently located in the United Arab Emirates. Modern ones often use the tube frame design, which superseded the steel frame of earlier structures. Louis Sullivan is known as the father of these structures. Name this kind of large building, examples of which include the Burj Khalifa and the Empire State Building.

It is not an amalgam, but this substance is a catalyst in the Clemmensen reduction. The Leblanc process has been abandoned because it generates this compound as a byproduct. Industrially, this compound is used to pickle steel and synthesize PVC plastics, and with nitric acid, it forms aqua regia. Found in gastric juice name this binary acid composed of a hydrogen atom and the second lightest halogen, also known as HCl.

This politician requested that James K. Polk specify the "spot" where Mexicans spilled blood on American soil in his "Spot Resolutions." In his Cooper Union address, this politician affirmed his opposition to expansion of slavery. This politician stated that "a house divided against itself cannot stand" in a speech against Stephen Douglas. Name this politician who, as president, issued the Emancipation Proclamation.

This college's football team, known for its iconic blue turf field nicknamed "The Blue," pulled off a stunning upset in the 2007 Fiesta Bowl, defeating the Oklahoma Sooners with a series of trick plays, including the "Statue of Liberty" play for a game-winning two-point conversion.  They have won six conference championships since joining the Mountain West Conference in 2011. Name this Broncos team who is currently led by record-breaking running back Ashton Jeanty.

One ruler of this empire named Auraungzeb re-established the jizya tax to encourage conversion to the religion it followed. This empire was founded by Babur and reached its zenith under Akbar. One ruler of this empire built a large white marble mausoleum in the city of Agra for his wife Mumtaz. Shah Jahan, commissioner of the Taj Mahal, ruled what Indian Islamic empire?

In a story by this author, a songbird sings so beautifully that he convinces Death to spare the Emperor of China. This man wrote about Gerda, who rescues her friend Kai after he is carried away by a mysterious woman in a sleigh. In another story by this man, a sea witch takes the voice of a mermaid who has fallen in love with a prince. Name this Danish author of fairy tales like "The Nightingale," "The Snow Queen,"and "The Little Mermaid."

This ocean includes the Cocos or Keeling Islands. On another island in this ocean in 2018, John Allen Chau was killed while trying to serve as a missionary to the Sentinelese. This ocean includes the Gulf of Khambhat and the Meghna River delta which are, respectively, part of the Arabian Sea and Bay of Bengal found on opposite sides of the country that shares its name with this ocean. Name this ocean between Africa and Australia.

One version of this molecule found in purple bacteria can accept electrons from hydrogen sulfide instead of water. Along with carotenoids, this molecule is found in the thylakoid membrane, and its a and b types can be separated by paper chromatography. Forming the reaction centers of Photosystems I and II, this pigment molecule absorbs light in the red, blue, and violet wavelengths. Giving plants their characteristic color by reflecting green light, name this pigment molecule that captures the light energy used to power photosynthesis.

This policy had its origins in the Pass Laws, and several people who were opposed to this policy were sentenced to prison following the Rivonia Trials. The Spear of the Nation was the military wing of a political party which opposed this policy, which led to the Sharpeville Massacre as well as an event in which students who opposed the mandatory teaching of a certain language were fired upon by police, the Soweto Uprising. Ended by F.W. De Klerk and Nelson Mandela name this policy of racial segregation in South Africa.

This country will hold elections on February 23, 2025 after its chancellor lost a no-confidence vote, causing the government to collapse. Its parliament, known as the Bundestag, is elected every four years and is responsible for making laws and overseeing the government. Its head of state is the Federal President, currently Frank-Walter Steinmeier, who holds a largely ceremonial role. The chancellor, Olaf Scholz, led a three-party coalition government consisting of the Social Democratic Party, the Green Party, and the Free Democratic Party. What is this European nation, known for its federal republic system and its role as a leading economic power in the European Union?

This woman was the first president of the Ninety-Nines. With funding from Purdue, where she served as a technical adviser, this woman constructed a modified Model 10 Electra. A breakdown of communication between the Itasca and Fred Noonan caused this woman's failure to find Howland Island. Name this first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean, who disappeared over the Pacific in 1937.

This footballer recently won his first MLS MVP Award. The player, who led Argentina to victory in the 2022 World Cup, holds the record for the most Ballon d'Or awards, with eight wins to his name. He is known for his mesmerizing dribbling skills, clinical finishing, and playmaking ability, often leaving defenders bewildered. He spent the majority of his career with FC Barcelona, where he won numerous trophies and became the club's all-time leading scorer. Who is this Argentine forward, widely regarded as one of the greatest footballers of all time?

This poet described how "a Plank in Reason, broke" in the poem "I felt a Funeral, in my Brain," and wrote that "'Hope' is a thing with feathers" in another poem. This poet wrote "I heard a Fly buzz - when I died" and a poem in which the speaker rides in a carriage with "Immortality" and a being who "kindly stopped for me." Name this Belle of Amherst, a reclusive poet who wrote "Because I could not stop for Death."

This sandbox video game, whose soundtrack was composed by German musician C418, features a distinctive blocky art style and allows players to build structures, explore procedurally generated worlds, and gather resources in a variety of biomes.  Its "Survival" mode challenges players to gather resources, craft tools, and build shelter to survive against hostile creatures.  Its "Creative" mode provides unlimited resources and the ability to fly, allowing players to unleash their imaginations and build elaborate structures.  What is the name of this popular game, developed by Mojang Studios and acquired by Microsoft in 2014?

This swimmer's thrilling victory in the 400-meter freestyle at the 2020 Tokyo Olympics ended Katie Ledecky's dominance in the event and marked a changing of the guard in women's distance swimming.  She holds the world record in the 400-meter freestyle. She also excels in the 200-meter and 800-meter freestyle events, consistently challenging for medals on the world stage. Who is this Australian swimmer, known for her powerful stroke and competitive spirit?

The murder of this man's friend Abraham Gonzalez deepened his hatred of Victoriano Huerta. This man gained control of the vast mineral wealth of Chihuahua during his time as caudillo of that province. This man commanded the Division of the North, with which he helped the Carranza government take power before launching a raid on Columbus, New Mexico in 1916. Name this famous Mexican revolutionary who was chased by John J. Pershing's Punitive Expedition.

Darwin predicted the existence of a Madagascar moth after observing one of these structures, which have separate male/female types in dioecious species. The parts of this occur in multiples of three in monocots and many use nectar to attract pollinators. One mature part of this becomes the fruit, and it has stamen and carpel reproductive organs. Name this structure found in angiosperm plants, often surrounded by petals.

In April 2011 this country announced it was "for rent," eight years after its Head of State, Hans Adam II, joked about selling it to Bill Gates and renaming it Microsoft. This nation and Uzbekistan are the only double-landlocked countries in the world, and it is the wealthiest per capita German-speaking country. Name this principality between Switzerland and Austria with capital Vaduz.

This band's iconic song "Good Vibrations," featuring innovative recording techniques and an array of instruments like the theremin and cello, was one of the most expensive singles ever produced at the time.  Their album Pet Sounds, released in 1966, is considered a masterpiece of pop music, with its intricate harmonies and introspective lyrics.  Their early surf rock anthems like "Surfin' U.S.A." and "California Girls" captured the carefree spirit of Southern California youth culture.  What is the name of this influential band, led by Brian Wilson's songwriting and musical vision?

This figure was given a crown and necklaces by the Horae and the Graces for her wedding. This figure's daughter with Epimetheus, Pyrrha, was a survivor in the Greek flood myth. Zeus ordered Hephaestus to make this first woman out of earth and air to punish mankind for accepting the gift of fire from this woman's brother-in-law, Prometheus. All of the evils in the world were released when what mythological woman opened her namesake "box?"

One man with this surname ran a campaign ad about the prisoner Willie Horton. A recount of "hanging chad" ballots in Florida enabled another man with this surname to narrowly defeat Al Gore in one election. A man with this surname who promised, "Read my lips: no new taxes" later lost re-election in 1992 to Bill Clinton. Give this surname of two U.S. Presidents named George.

International snack giant Mondelez is said to be considering buying this American brand. This company's founder established a vocational school for orphaned boys in 1909, using his chocolate fortune to fund the institution. Its iconic milk chocolate bar, introduced in 1900, was the first mass-produced milk chocolate bar in the United States. This company founded a town in Pennsylvania around its first factory. Name this company known for its distinctive Kisses chocolates.

One artist depicted this figure lying on a bed and staring into a mirror held in front of a red curtain. A girl looks into a chest in the background as a dog curls up on a bed with this figure in another painting. A third artist depicted this woman in front of a broken arch of trees and to the right of the Three Graces. The spring Hora brings a pink cloak towards this figure as she stands nude atop a scallop shell in another work by that artist. Name this Roman goddess of love, whose "birth" was depicted by Sandro Botticelli.

This holiday commemorates the rededication of the Second Temple in Jerusalem following a revolt led by Judas Maccabeus against the Seleucid Empire. The holiday's central ritual involves lighting a nine-branched menorah adding one candle each night for eight nights. The miracle of the oil, where a one-day supply of oil miraculously burned for eight days, is a central theme of the celebration.  What is this Jewish holiday, often referred to as the "Festival of Lights"?

For any integer N, the sum of all numbers having this property from 1 to N must be a perfect square. It has been proven that for all numbers less than ten to the three hundredth power, there are no perfect numbers with this property. The tangent and sine functions both have this property, which applies to any function for which f of x plus f of negative x equals zero, and is therefore symmetric about the origin. Every binary number with this property must end in 1, and all prime numbers but the smallest have this property. Identify this class of numbers, which leave a remainder when divided by two.

The "Six Arrows" represent the ideology of this country's founder, who introduced the Latin alphabet to it and banned the wearing of fezzes. This country contains the largest population of Kurds in its southeast, and its first president was Mustafa Kemal Ataturk. In 1922, the Ottoman Empire was replaced by what country which contains the transcontinental city of Istanbul?

This animated tragicomedy series features a protagonist who is a washed-up actor struggling with addiction, depression, and the weight of his past fame. Its voice cast includes Will Arnett, Aaron Paul as Todd Chavez, and Alison Brie as Diane Nguyen.  What is the name of this Netflix series, known for its dark humor and anthropomorphic animals?

During a 1793 yellow fever outbreak in this city, Dr Benjamin Rush accidentally killed dozens of patients by treating them with bloodletting. William Howe captured this city in the aftermath of the Battle of Brandywine, a victory that forced the Continental Congress to flee to nearby Lancaster. The Liberty Bell was originally located in this city's Independence Hall, which hosted the signing of the Declaration of Independence. Name this largest city in Pennsylvania.

This man recently defeated Tyson Fury in a rematch to retain the heavyweight title. This boxer, a former undisputed cruiserweight champion, made history by becoming only the third boxer ever to unify the WBA, IBF, WBO, and IBO heavyweight titles after moving up in weight class. He is known for his exceptional footwork, technical skills, and southpaw stance, which often befuddle opponents. He defeated Anthony Joshua twice in 2021 and 2022 to claim and defend his heavyweight titles. Before his professional boxing career, he won an Olympic gold medal at the 2012 London Games. Who is this Ukrainian boxer, nicknamed "The Cat"?

This nation's port cities include Valparaiso and Antofagasta, the latter of which was invaded for its nitrate and copper resources to begin the War of the Pacific. This country is home to Easter Island and the incredibly dry Atacama Desert, which lies in a rain shadow west of the Andes Mountains. This country's border with Argentina runs for 3,300 miles, north to south. Name this South American country with capital at Santiago.

The Tacuara was a right-wing group that attacked in this country during the presidency of Arturo Frondozi. The Revolucion Libertadora ended the rule of one man in this country. The Dirty War in this nation followed a coup that overthrew Isabel Peron and set forth a junta that failed to take the Falkland Islands from Great Britain. The largest country created out of the Viceroyalty of the Rio de la Plata, its independence was won through victories by Jose de San Martin. Name this country, currently led by Javier Milei, whose presidents rule from Buenos Aires.

In 2021, this state lost a case to California that would have overturned Obamacare. This state's Attorney General, Ken Paxton sued Pennsylvania to overturn the 2020 election. Due to a February 2021 storm, this state was hit with mass power outages, and a senator from this state was criticized for traveling to Cancun during the crisis. John Cornyn and Ted Cruz are from what state with capital Austin?

These molecules contain such unique nucleotides as pseudouridine, hypoxanthine, and inosinic acid. It has a CCA tail at the 3-end of the molecule, which is important for recognition in translation. First hypothesized by Francis Crick, they can come in aminoacyl and peptidyl varieties, which can be attached to two different sites on ribosomes. They have a loop for the anticodon, which makes them look like clover leaves. Identify these molecules that carry amino acids to ribosomes during protein synthesis, one of the three types of RNA.

This footballer, the youngest player to score in a FIFA World Cup final since Pelé in 1958, achieved this feat at the age of 19 during France's victory in the 2018 tournament.  He is known for his blistering speed, clinical finishing, and dribbling skills, often leaving defenders in his wake.  He played for Paris Saint-Germain before moving to Real Madrid. Who is this French forward, considered one of the most exciting young talents in world football?

This animated series follows the journey of Aang, a 12-year-old boy who is a spiritual leader destined to bring peace to the war-torn world.  The show's unique blend of Eastern philosophy, martial arts, and compelling characters resonated with audiences of all ages.  Its animation style, inspired by anime and traditional Chinese art, created a visually stunning world.  What is the name of this Nickelodeon series, which has garnered critical acclaim for its storytelling, animation, and cultural impact?

Vritra and Tiamat are two of these creatures, who are slain by Indra and Marduk, respectively. Another one, Nithogg, gnaws on a root of Yggdrasil, and Orochi is an eight-headed one who is killed by Susanoo. One of these animals represents the east, and is known as Qinglong in China and Seiryuu in Japan. In Greek myth, warriors grow when the teeth of these creatures are planted. Name these mythological creatures, enormous reptiles that typically breathe fire in Western tradition.

An Art Deco skyscraper built in 1931 in this city was the tallest building west of the Mississippi River until 1961 and is named for a company that left the building in 1991. This city's 18th & Vine district is home to the American Jazz Museum and Negro Leagues Baseball Museum. It's not Los Angeles, but a one block area with frequent live music performances known as "this city Live!" sits in this city's Power & Light District. A baseball stadium nicknamed "The K" is located in what Missouri city, which shares its name with a city in a neighboring state?

This politician fell and broke her hip while travelling with a congressional delegation in Luxembourg. She was born and raised in Baltimore, and is the daughter of mayor and congressman Thomas D'Alesandro Jr. She served as the speaker of the house from 2007 to 2011 and again from 2019 to 2023. She was the first woman elected as U.S. House Speaker and the first woman to lead a major political party in either chamber of Congress, leading the House Democrats from 2003 to 2023. Name this congresswoman who represents San Francisco.

The Atbarah is an arm of this river that starts at Lake Tana. The Aswan High Dam, an attempt to control this river's flow, resulted in the creation of Lake Nasser, a massive reservoir shared by two nations. This river splits into two different sections near Khartoum, the Blue and the White. Identify this river considered the lifeblood of civilizations in Sudan and Egypt, the longest river in the world.

This cult classic TV series, set in the fictional town of Sunnydale, California, which is located on a Hellmouth, follows a teenage girl chosen to battle vampires, demons, and the forces of darkness. Its creator, Joss Whedon, also known for his work on "Firefly" and "The Avengers," explored themes of identity, growing up, and the struggle between good and evil.  What is the name of this series, which ran for seven seasons and spawned a spin-off series, "Angel"?

This process is defined as the movement of soil or sediment from one location to another by means of water flow, wind or gravity. The Grand Canyon was formed by this process. Trees and plants help hold soil in place to help prevent this process. Name this geological process.

The US Department of Agriculture announced this dangerous invasive species has been eradicated from the United States. This insect, native to Asia and known for its aggressive behavior and painful sting, poses a significant threat to honeybee populations and human health. Its large size, with queens reaching up to two inches in length, and its distinctive orange and black markings make it easily recognizable. Its venom, though not typically fatal to humans, can cause severe pain and allergic reactions. It was first detected in North America in 2019, prompting efforts to eradicate it and prevent its spread. What is this invasive species, also known as the Asian giant hornet?

This quarterback, known for his cool demeanor and clutch performances under pressure, led LSU to a national championship in 2019, throwing for a record-breaking 60 touchdowns in a single season. He was drafted first overall by the Cincinnati Bengals in the 2020 NFL Draft, and quickly revitalized the franchise. He led the Bengals to their first Super Bowl appearance in over 30 years in 2022, narrowly losing to the Los Angeles Rams. Who is this quarterback, nicknamed "Joe Cool" for his calm and collected leadership style?

A house on this city's Osage Avenue was bombed by its own police in 1985. Both Boston and this city benefitted from a two-century-long experiment in compound interest by Ben Franklin. The First and Second Banks of the United States were located in this city, whose Carpenters' Hall and Independence Hall hosted the two Continental Congresses. Name this former national capital, the largest city in Pennsylvania.

The first of this set of principles requires two witnesses and a sincere confession, and is called shahada, the profession of faith. Adherents wear ihram and walk around the Kaaba during a holy trip that these principles require all Muslims make. Sawm and salat are two of what fundamental principles of Islam that require Muslims to make a pilgrimage to Mecca and fast during Ramadan?

The "Yellow Fleet" was stuck in this structure's Great Bitter Lake after it was closed during the Six-Day War. Gamal Abdel Nasser's nationalization of this structure caused a 1956 "crisis." The ship Ever Given was stuck at this structure, whose construction greatly reduced travel times between the Indian Ocean and Europe. Shipping was disrupted in 2021 when a boat clogged what man-made Egyptian canal?

Characters in this novel go to the Malpais reservation in New Mexico, where they meet Linda, whose son remembers her relationship with Pope while watching Three Weeks in a Helicopter. This novel opens by describing the Bokanovsky process, and in this work, Helmholtz Watson is exiled to the Falkland Islands by Mustapha Mond. John the Savage and Bernard Marx oppose the drug Soma in what dystopian novel by Aldous Huxley?

This holiday's traditional figure is based on a 4th-century Greek bishop known for his generosity. The holiday's association with its current date was established in the 4th century, coinciding with the Roman celebration of Saturnalia and the winter solstice. The tradition of decorating evergreen trees dates back to pre-Christian pagan practices. What is this holiday, celebrated by Christians worldwide to commemorate the birth of Jesus Christ?

This quarterback set the NFL record for the most passing yards by a player in their first two seasons, showcasing his exceptional talent and potential.  He was drafted sixth overall by the Los Angeles Chargers in the 2020 NFL Draft, and quickly established himself as a franchise quarterback.  He led the Chargers to their first playoff appearance in four years in 2022, narrowly losing to the Jacksonville Jaguars in a thrilling comeback.  Who is this quarterback, known for his calm demeanor and ability to make highlight-reel throws?

The Channel Islands are located off this state's southern coast. Mount Whitney, the highest peak in the contiguous US, lies in this state's portion of the Sierra Nevada. The Calaveras, Hayward, and San Andreas faults run along this state's Pacific coast. Name this state, the home of the San Francisco 49ers and Sacramento Kings.

This television series, set in a fictional Yorkshire country estate, follows the lives of the aristocratic Crawley family and their servants in the post-Edwardian era. The show's creator, Julian Fellowes, is also known for writing the screenplay for the Oscar-winning film "Gosford Park."  Its storylines explore themes of social change, class conflict, and the impact of historical events like World War I and the sinking of the Titanic.  What is the name of this popular historical drama, which has garnered numerous awards and critical acclaim?

These natural events occur most intensely at a place just above the focus called the epicenter. Seismologists study these events. They occur when tectonic plates slide against each other in boundaries called faults. Name these natural disasters which cause the ground to shake.

Thomas Jefferson expected this mission to uncover a mountain of salt and wooly mammoths. This mission was trying to find a way to travel from the Missouri River to the Pacific Ocean. Name this mission, named after its two leaders who traveled with an Indian guide named Sacagawea.

During this dynasty, the encyclopedia Siku Quanshu was compiled. This dynasty saw a failed hundred-day reform movement led by Emperor Guangxu, who was placed under house arrest. The Xinhai Revolution ended this dynasty that was weakened by a long reign of the ultra-conservative Dowager Emperor Cixi. This dynasty once faced the White Lotus Rebellion as well as another rebellion led by one who claimed to be the brother of Jesus, the Taiping Rebellion. Identify this Chinese dynasty that was succeeded by Sun Yat-sen's Republic of China in 1911.

This country's city of Manaus is located at the confluence of the Solimoes and Negro rivers. Its capital city was designed by Lucio Costa and Oscar Niemeyer. One city in this nation is home to the statue of Christ the Redeemer. This largest Portuguese-speaking country is home to the mouth of the world's second longest river. Name this largest country in South America that is home to Rio de Janeiro.

This holiday has a name derived from a Swahili phrase meaning "first fruits." The Kinara, a seven-branched candle holder, is a central symbol of the holiday, with each candle representing a different principle. It is observed from December 26th to January 1st, with each of the seven days dedicated to one of seven principles known as the Nguzo Saba. What is this holiday, celebrated by many African Americans as a time for reflection, community, and cultural affirmation?

Amazonstone and cleavelandite are members of this group of minerals. Samples of it which show a high opalescence are traded as moonstone, and some with a yellow or orange tint are sold as sunstone. The plagioclase and alkali forms of this mineral are prevalent in granite. Made of aluminum, silicon, and either calcium, sodium, or potassium name this mineral, number 6 on the Mohs scale of hardness.

She was given nearly dictatorial powers during the Indian Emergency, a two-year period which saw her suspend nearly all civil liberties. However, she was widely praised for holding fair elections after the end of the emergency, which saw her Congress Party swept from power in the Lok Sabha. She later initiated Operation Blue Star, the infamous raid on the Sikh Golden Temple in Amritsar, which led to her assassination by her own bodyguards and subsequent anti-Sikh rioting. Name this fourth prime minister of India who, despite her name, is not related to Mahatma.

This golfer, whose career has been marked by both incredible triumphs and personal struggles, made a remarkable comeback in 2019 by winning the Masters Tournament, his first major championship victory in 11 years.  He famously won the 1997 Masters by a record 12 strokes, becoming the youngest champion at age 21.  He has won 15 major championships, second only to Jack Nicklaus.  He is also known for holding all four major titles simultaneously in 2000-2001.  Who is this iconic golfer, widely considered one of the greatest of all time?

Protesters chanted "the whole world is watching" at this city's police during the 1968 Democratic National Convention. In this city, members of Bugs Moran's gang were killed in the St. Valentine's Day Massacre. Supposedly, Mrs. O'Leary's cow kicked over a lantern to begin an 1871 fire in this city. This city was home to notorious gangster Al Capone. Name this largest city in Illinois.

The protagonist of this novel secretly reads The Theory and Practice of Oligarchical Collectivism in a room above Mr Charrington's shop while on break from the Ministry of Truth. In this novel, citizens of Airstrip One who do not conform to the ideology of The Party are sent to Room 101 to be subjected to their worst fear. In this novel, Winston Smith is eventually arrested for thoughtcrime against Big Brother. Name this dystopian novel, set in the title year, written by George Orwell.

This band's 1987 album, Document, featuring the hit song "The One I Love," was their first to achieve platinum status, marking a turning point in their career. Their music videos, often featuring surreal imagery and cryptic symbolism, were directed by filmmaker Tarsem Singh, known for his visually striking style. Their early jangle-pop sound, influenced by bands like The Byrds and The Velvet Underground, helped define the alternative rock scene of the 1980s. What is the name of this influential Athens, Georgia band, whose lineup consisted of Michael Stipe, Peter Buck, Mike Mills, and Bill Berry?

This baseball legend passed away on December 20, 2024. He holds the Major League record for most career stolen bases, with an impressive 1,406 steals. He was a key member of the Oakland Athletics' 1989 World Series championship team, earning the World Series MVP award. He famously referred to himself in the third person, with quotes like "Rickey's the best!" becoming part of his charismatic persona. He also holds the record for most career runs scored, with 2,295 runs. Who is this Hall of Fame outfielder, often considered the greatest leadoff hitter of all time?

This video game, set in the American West in 1911, follows the story of John Marston, a former outlaw forced to hunt down his old gang members to protect his family.  The game's open world environment allows players to explore vast landscapes, from snow-capped mountains to arid deserts, encountering wildlife and engaging in various activities like hunting, gambling, and bounty hunting.  Its sequel, released in 2018, delves into the gang's backstory and features a new protagonist, Arthur Morgan.  What is the name of this critically acclaimed Western-themed action-adventure game developed by Rockstar Games?

Matthew, Chapter 28 notes that Jesus commanded his followers to "go therefore and make disciples of all nations" by performing this action. Seventh-day Adventists reserve this practice for adults, though in most Christian denominations it is primarily for infants. Identify this Christian initiation sacrament in which participants are sprinkled with or immersed in water.

This is the name of a river that flows from Pittsburgh to Illinois, passing by Louisville, Kentucky. It is also the name of a state that borders Lake Erie and contains the cities of Akron and Dayton. Give this name shared by a major American river and the state containing Cleveland.

This modern nation was the former site of the Etruscan civilization. Home to the 1860 Expedition of the Thousand and the 1823 Piedmont uprising, the coal burners influenced the Risorgimento process of this modern country, and Victor Emmanuel II was its first unified king. After being exiled to South America, one leader from this nation organized the Redshirts. Home to revolutionary Giuseppe Garibaldi, name this country, led in World War II by the fascist Blackshirts of Benito Mussolini.

Some delivery drivers for this company went on strike from December 20-24, 2024 at the peak of Christmas package season. The drivers were part of the Teamsters union which only represents a small fraction of the company's more than 70,000 employees. This company's logo features an arrow pointing from A to Z, symbolizing its vast selection and its goal to deliver everything to everyone. Its founder initially envisioned the company as an online bookstore named Cadabra. Its headquarters, located in Seattle, Washington, features unique biodome spheres that house thousands of plants from around the world. It has expanded beyond e-commerce to become a major player in cloud computing, artificial intelligence, and entertainment. What is the name of this multinational technology company founded by Jeff Bezos?

Hellworth and McClung produced a "pulsed" one of these devices using Q-switching. One of these devices nicknamed Shiva, was fitted with neodymium glass and failed to ignite its target reaction even with twenty beamlines. The "fiber" ones of these devices use total internal reflection to transmit a coherent photon stream produced by the stimulated emission of radiation. Name these devices that produce a colored beam of light.
answers: light amplification by stimulated emission of radiation

question: This country considered giving the mountain Halti to a neighbor to celebrate that neighbor's 100th birthday. This country's capital was named Christiania until merging with another village in 1925. A museum in this country is dedicated to painter Edvard Munch. This country's west coast, on the Atlantic ocean, is famous for its fjords. Name this Scandinavian country whose capital city is Oslo.

This American sportscaster recently passed away at age 78. The first African-American to host a major network's coverage of a Super Bowl, he has been a prominent voice in sports broadcasting for over four decades. He has covered a wide range of events, including the NCAA Men's Basketball Tournament, the NBA Finals, and the Olympic Games. He is known for his smooth delivery, insightful commentary, and professionalism. He is the older brother of another renowned broadcaster, Bryant Gumbel, who hosted NBC's "Today" show for many years. Who is this respected sportscaster?

Fry's Island and Canvey Island lie within this river with tributaries that include the Churn, Leach, Cole, Ray, and Windrush Rivers. T.S. Eliot makes many references to this river in part three of The Wasteland, and artists including Canaletto, Monet, Whistler, and JMW Turner have all based major works on this river. Ending after Teddington Lock near the lighthouse at Nore is what river that empties into the North Sea and flows through central London?

This woman was held against her will at Henricus after being captured by Samuel Argall. After studying under Alexander Whitaker, this woman converted to Christianity, took the name Rebecca, and ultimately died while visiting England with her husband, John Rolfe. This woman allegedly stopped her father from beating a Jamestown colonist to death. Name this daughter of Powhatan who legendarily saved the life of John Smith.

An inadequate amount of this substance is produced by the body in thalassemia. A variant of this substance is responsible for providing a certain gas to nitrogen-fixing bacteria and is prefixed with "leg-." A waste product resulting from the breakdown of this substance gives the skin its yellow color in jaundice and is called bilirubin. Carbon monoxide poisoning occurs because this protein binds to carbon monoxide much more tightly than to its target. This iron-containing protein is found in red blood cells. Name this protein that transports oxygen from the lungs to body tissues.

This leader has a halo, crown, and purple robe in a namesake "mosaic" in Ravenna's Church of San Vitale. One of this leader's generals defeated the Vandals at Ad Decimum and Tricamarum and fought Khosrau I of the Sassanid Empire. The blues and the greens fought over a chariot race during this emperor's reign, which saw the creation of the Corpus Juris Civilis. Belisarius captured Rome and put down the Nika riots for this husband of Theodora, who ordered the construction of the Hagia Sophia. Name this "great" Byzantine emperor.

This North American chain of stores announced in December 2024 it will close all of its 800+ locations. This company, known for its vast assortment of party supplies and costumes, filed for bankruptcy in January 2023, facing challenges from online retailers and shifting consumer trends. Its iconic retail stores, often adorned with colorful balloons and festive decorations, have been a staple for party planners and last-minute shoppers. Name this company that is the largest retailer of party goods in Canada, Puerto Rico, and Mexico.

This language was used to chronicle the journeys of two giants who traveled the world, Gargantua and Pantagruel. One work in this language that calls boredom the "worst of miseries" and contains allegedly obscene symbolist poetry has a title that translates as The Flowers of Evil. Medieval songs in an earlier form of this language were sung by Occitan troubadours and included the story of wars against the Moors by Paladins in The Song of Roland. Name this language in which Charles Baudelaire wrote Les Fleurs du Mal.

This film, set in a dystopian future Britain ruled by a totalitarian regime, features a masked vigilante who blows up the Houses of Parliament on November 5th, a date commemorating the historical Gunpowder Plot. The film's protagonist played by Hugo Weaving, is a skilled swordsman and master of disguise who seeks to overthrow the oppressive government. The film's iconic Guy Fawkes mask, worn by V, has become a symbol of rebellion and anti-establishment movements worldwide. What is the title of this 2005 film, based on the graphic novel by Alan Moore and David Lloyd?

This Greek god comforted Ariadne after Theseus abandoned her. This god took mercy on Tyrrhenian pirates who had kidnapped him by turning them into dolphins so they would not drown. This god inspired his followers, the Maenads, to murder Orpheus, and carried a staff topped by a pinecone called the Thyrsus. Name this "twice-born" Greek god, who was born from the thigh of Zeus, and who governed vineyards and wine.

US workers at this coffee chain ended a five-day strike on Christmas Day 2024. The company's origins trace back to 1971, when it was founded in Seattle's Pike Place Market, selling coffee beans and brewing equipment. It has since expanded to over 33,000 stores in 80 countries, becoming a global coffeehouse giant. This company, whose logo features a siren from Greek mythology, introduced the Frappuccino, a blended iced coffee drink, in 1995, and it quickly became a signature offering and cultural phenomenon. Name this worldwide coffee chain.

During this man's tenure as Secretary of War under James Monroe he called for the censure and trial of Andrew Jackson due to his capture of Spanish Florida. Due to this man's longetivity and ability as a Senator, he was identified as a member of the "Great Triumvirate" of Congressional leaders along with Henry Clay and Daniel Webster. In his essay "South Carolina Exposition and Protest," he outlined the doctrine of nullification and approved of its usage by states. Name this long time Senator from South Carolina who resigned the Vice Presidency due to his disagreement with President Jackson over the "Tariff of Abominations."

One speech given in this city notes that "two thousand years ago, the proudest boast was 'civis Romanus sum'" and claims "all free men ... are citizens of" this city. Another speech given here asks a world leader "if you seek peace... if you seek liberalization: come here to this gate!" John F. Kennedy said "Ich bin" a member of this city, and Ronald Reagan said "Mr. Gorbachev, tear down this wall!" in what capital of Germany?

This river was known in ancient times as the "Black" River due to the black silt it deposited during floods. Lake Tana is one source of this river; John Speke discovered that the other was Lake Victoria. It forms from the confluence of namesake Blue and White Rivers near Khartoum. Aswan High Dam is on what longest river in the world?

This athlete, known for his flamboyant personality and "Prime Time" nickname, is the only person to have played in both a Super Bowl and a World Series. He was a two-sport star, excelling in both football and baseball, playing for teams like the Atlanta Falcons, San Francisco 49ers, and Atlanta Braves. He was renowned for his exceptional speed, agility, and coverage skills as a cornerback and kick returner. He is also known for his high-stepping touchdown celebrations and his distinctive "Prime Time" dance. Who is this Hall of Fame athlete, who now serves as the football coach at Colorado University?

This franchise's iconic mascot, an electric mouse known for its lightning bolt-shaped tail, has become a global phenomenon, appearing in countless merchandise and spin-offs. Its first video game installments, Red and Green, were released in Japan in 1996 for the Game Boy, introducing the core gameplay mechanics of catching, training, and battling. The franchise has expanded to include a popular anime series, trading cards, toys, and numerous other products. What is the name of this multimedia franchise, centered around fictional creatures with unique abilities and elemental powers?

Along with Venus, this is the only other planet in our Solar System to have a retrograde orbit, and its rotational axis is almost sideways compared to its orbit. This planet is the coldest in the solar system, earning it the description "ice giant" along with Neptune, which is further from the Sun. What planet is seventh from the Sun?

A holder of this position quipped "just watch me" after invoking the War Measures Act to stop the breakaway of a secessionist region in the October Crisis. Lester B. Pearson served in this office after winning a Nobel Peace Prize for resolving the Suez Crisis. The first holder of this office was forced to resign after it was exposed he had taken bribes over the choice route for a transcontinental railroad. That man was John A. MacDonald. Name this position held by Pierre Trudeau, as well as his son, Justin, the head of government of a nation to the north of the U.S.

This god created humans after descending into the Underworld and piercing his own skin until heavy volumes of blood flowed out. He often feuded with a brother nicknamed "Smoking Mirror", who was often depicted as a jaguar. This deity was often depicted as a feathered serpent and was the patron of maize growing. Hernan Cortes was mistaken for this god by a Mesoamerican civilization. Name this chief god of the Aztecs.

This state's city of Beaumont near Port Arthur is home to Spindletop, the site of a 1901 discovery that triggered an economic boom. Geologists in this state have a hard time studying its Barnett Shale, a formation with massive natural gas reserves, because it lies underneath a sprawling metroplex that includes Plano and Fort Worth. Name this southern US state where the oil industry grew the cities of Dallas and Houston.

This epic fantasy trilogy's fictional language, Quenya, was created by their author, a philologist and professor of Anglo-Saxon. An artifact of immense power in the series bears the inscription of Black Speech that translates to "One ring to rule them all, one ring to find them, one ring to bring them all and in the darkness bind them." The story follows the hobbit Frodo Baggins on his quest to destroy the One Ring, an artifact of immense power coveted by the Dark Lord Sauron. What is the title of this fantasy epic, which has been adapted into award-winning films directed by Peter Jackson?

This former NFL quarterback was recently hired to be the head coach of Norfolk State's football team. He was the first quarterback in NFL history to rush for over 1,000 yards in a single season, achieving this feat in 2006. He was drafted first overall by the Atlanta Falcons in the 2001 NFL Draft. His career was marred by controversy when he was convicted of dogfighting charges in 2007, serving 21 months in prison. He later returned to the NFL, playing for the Philadelphia Eagles, New York Jets, and Pittsburgh Steelers. Who is this quarterback, whose career was marked by both incredible talent and controversy?

An Azerbaijan Airlines flight recently crashed in this country, killing 38 people on December 25, 2024. Azerbaijan has since claimed the plane was shot down by Russian air defense systems. This country, the largest landlocked country in the world, is home to the Baikonur Cosmodrome, the world's first and largest operational space launch facility. Its capital city, Astana, boasts futuristic architecture, including the Baiterek Tower, a 97-meter-tall observation tower with a golden orb symbolizing a mythical bird's egg. It is also the world's largest producer of uranium and a significant exporter of oil and gas. What is this Central Asian nation, known for its vast steppes, nomadic traditions, and the hit film "Borat"?

A leader of this country oversaw the first partition of Poland after the Confederation of the Bar revolted against her lover, Stanislaw Poniatowski. This country established a capital on the Neva River after seizing land from Sweden during the Great Northern War. This country was rapidly westernized under Peter I, who forced the boyars to pay a beard tax. Name this country where Catherine the Great was crowned Tsarina in Moscow.

This word describes a method of proof that attempts to write every number in binary, then constructs a number that cannot have been represented in that list; that argument shows that the real numbers are uncountable and was advanced by Cantor. This word also refers to square matrices whose only nonzero elements have a row number equal to their column number. For a cube of side length s, the structure by this name has a length of s root 3. Give this word that refers to line segments that connect non-adjacent vertices of a polygon.

This philosopher discussed a Confederacy of Deceivers in one work, causing a debate between him and John Bramhall. This man wrote a trilogy of works including De Corpore, De Homine, and De Cive. His most famous work sees him discuss three types of commonwealth and claim that "the war of all against all" will only be averted by strong central government; that work centers around the legitimate representative government and claim that life is "solitary, poor, nasty, brutish, and short." Identify this author of Leviathan.

This fantasy series' protagonist, whose middle name is James, shares his birthday with his creator, July 31st.  The series' iconic villain whose name is an anagram for "Tom Marvolo Riddle," fears death and seeks immortality through dark magic.  The series' magical creatures, like house-elves and hippogriffs, are inspired by folklore and mythology.  What is the name of this beloved series, which follows a young wizard's journey through Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry?

The Brule River runs through the northwest of this polity, and an extremely low frequency antenna was once operational in this polity's Chequamegon Nicolet National Forest. Washington Island is separated by "Death's Door" from Door County in this state, whose namesake river flows through Stevens Point. The cities of Sheboygan and Kenosha lie on the shore of Lake Michigan. Name this state to the north of Illinois with capital at Madison.

This man rose to the rank of major when he retired from the army at age 22 in 1865. His election to Congress in 1876 was in part helped by Rutherford B. Hayes, and he chaired the Committee on Ways and Means from 1889 to 1891. His namesake tariff act set an average rate for imports at 48.4% and he used his advocacy of the gold standard and a brilliant advertising campaign designed by Mark Hanna to become the last Civil War veteran elected President in 1896. What president, defeated William Jennings Bryant before being assassinated by Leon Czolgosz in 1901?

This team's iconic orange, blue, and white jerseys, a tribute to their provincial flag, have become synonymous with a dynasty that dominated the NHL in the 1980s. They have won five Stanley Cups, all between 1984 and 1990, led by Wayne Gretzky, often considered the greatest hockey player of all time.  Their current captain, Connor McDavid, is a generational talent who has already won multiple scoring titles and MVP awards.  What is the name of this team, based in Edmonton, Alberta?

The liver converts this vitamin into calcidiol, which is then converted to calcitriol in the kidneys. Forms of this vitamin act as a hormone that regulates phosphate and calcium concentration in the body and this vitamin is produced with UV light exposure. Shortage of this vitamin causes osteomalacia in adults and rickets in children. Name this fat-soluble vitamin obtained from sunbathing or drinking milk.

Philae was the center of this goddess's cult. This goddess made a snake out of earth to bite Ra, which forced Ra to give up his true name. This goddess searched for a tamarisk tree to find her dead husband after he was tricked by Set; she later reassembled thirteen pieces of that husband to make him the god of the dead. Name this Egyptian goddess, the mother of Horus and wife of Osiris.

Israel launched an attack against the Houthi rebels in this nation. This country, located on the southern tip of the Arabian Peninsula, is home to the ancient city of Sana'a, a UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its distinctive tower houses.  It is the poorest country in the Arab world, facing a devastating humanitarian crisis due to an ongoing civil war.  It is also where the "Dragon's Blood Tree" grows, a unique species with red sap that has been used for centuries for medicinal and dye purposes.  What is this country, known for its rich history and its ongoing conflict?

One symbol of a 1956 revolution in this country was its flag with a hole cut out of the middle; after that revolution failed it was led by Janos Kadar, a proponent of "goulash communism", named for a popular national dish. This country once formed a dual monarchy with Austria, its western neighbor. Name this country now led by Viktor Orban from Budapest.

A Jeju Air Flight returning from Thailand recently crashed at Muan International Airport in this nation, killing 189 people. This country, known for its high-speed internet and tech-savvy population, is home to the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ), a heavily fortified border that separates it from its northern neighbor. Its capital city, Seoul, boasts a vibrant mix of modern skyscrapers and historic palaces, including the UNESCO-listed Changdeokgung Palace. It is also a global leader in the production of electronics and automobiles, with brands like Samsung and Hyundai recognized worldwide. What is this East Asian nation, known for its K-pop music, delicious kimchi, and innovative technology?

This novel and Native Son are criticized in James Baldwin's essay "Everybody's Protest Novel." The protagonist of this novel saves Eva St. Clare from drowning and is sold by Arthur Shelby. The author of this novel was supposedly called "the little woman that started this great war." The vicious plantation owner Simon Legree beats the title character of this novel to death. Name this anti-slavery novel by Harriet Beecher Stowe.

This state's northwest is home to Shiprock, an eroded volcanic plug held sacred by the region's native population. The White Sands National Monument lies in the southern part of this state, between the cities of Alamogordo and Las Cruces. It's not Nevada, but this state's city of Roswell is associated with an alleged UFO. Name this Southwestern state whose capital is Santa Fe.

This team's home arena, FLA Live Arena, located in Sunrise, Florida, has witnessed memorable moments like their thrilling run to the Stanley Cup Finals in 1996, where they ultimately fell to the Colorado Avalanche. They are known for their "Leap" tradition, where players jump into the glass after playoff victories, celebrating with their passionate fanbase. This team won their first Stanley Cup in 2024 defeating the Edmonton Oilers. What is the name of this team, whose history includes a memorable "rat trick" celebration led by Scott Mellanby in 1995?

Oliver Hazard Perry won the Battle of Lake Erie during this war, and a freak tornado stopped the British army from continuing to set fire to one city during it. During an attack on Fort McHenry in this war, Francis Scott Key composed "The Star-Spangled Banner". Washington, DC was burned during what 19th century war between the US and Britain named for the year in which it began?

Sierpinski's triangle is a fractal image created by shading this diagram's even numbers. The calculation "n choose k" will find the kth number in its nth row, and this diagram's rows list the binomial coefficients. A French mathematician names what expanding mathematical image whose first few rows are "1", then "1,1", then "1,2,1"?

This romantic comedy features a memorable scene in a crowded deli, leading to the iconic line, "I'll have what she's having." The film's central question, "Can men and women ever just be friends?", is explored through the evolving relationship between Harry Burns and Sally Albright. The film's soundtrack, featuring classic jazz standards by Harry Connick Jr., adds to its romantic and nostalgic atmosphere. What is the title of this 1989 film directed by Rob Reiner?

William Henry Harrison appointed Lancaster, Ohio native Thomas Ewing Jr. to this position, which was held by Roger B. Taney prior to becoming Supreme Court Chief Justice. The most famous man to hold this position was succeeded by Oliver Wolcott Jr., and it has been held by men such as Albert Gallatin, Levi Woodbury, and Andrew Mellon. The first man to hold it wrote the majority of the Federalist Papers and died following a duel with Aaron Burr. Identify this Cabinet position first held by Alexander Hamilton.

This city is home to the Tsing Ma Bridge, and more than 100,000 people live on its Lantau Island. This city, south of Shenzhen on the Kowloon Peninsula, was ceded to Britain in the Treaty of Nanking. This large city on the Pearl River Delta lies east of Macau, a "Special Administrative Region" like this city. Name this city, which has existed as "one country with two systems" since it was transferred to Chinese ownership in 1997.

Construction began in 312 BC, when the Roman army was being soundly defeated by the Samnites during the Second Samnite War. Named after a Roman censor who was noted for his public works projects, it was built with a swell in the middle to allow water to run off the sides, and it had ditches on both sides to collect the water. The emperor Trajan would later build the Via Traiana in order to reach by a shorter route. Identify this "queen of the long roads" leading to from the Roman coliseum.

This classic Thanksgiving comedy features a memorable scene where the two main characters, stuck sharing a cramped motel room with only one double bed, end up sleeping head-to-toe in an awkward embrace. The film's mismatched duo, Neal Page, a high-strung businessman, and Del Griffith, a boisterous shower curtain ring salesman, endure a series of misadventures as they try to get home for the holiday.  Their disastrous journey involves a rental car that catches fire, a stolen car that gets towed, and a train ride with uncomfortable seating arrangements. What is the title of this 1987 film directed by John Hughes?

This footballer, known for his signature "meditation" goal celebration, where he kneels and touches his forehead to the ground, became Liverpool's all-time leading Premier League goal scorer in 2023, surpassing Robbie Fowler's record.  He has won the Premier League Golden Boot award, given to the league's top scorer, three times.  He played a key role in Liverpool's Champions League victory in 2019 and their Premier League title win in 2020.  Who is this Egyptian forward, known for his blistering pace and clinical finishing?

The Antennae and The Mice are interacting examples of these objects, and Seyfert's Sextet are a group of them. Tidal tails form in these objects, when one or more of them merge. Edwin Hubble classified these on a "tuning fork diagram", which includes the elliptical and spiral types. M31 is the Andromeda example of, and our own Milky way is another of what large collections of stars?

This US president died on December 29, 2024. He was a prolific writer, setting a record for most New York Times best-selling books by a president. However, fewer books were written about him than any other modern president. He was the oldest US president in history, dying at age 100. This man negociated the Camp David Accords between Egypt and Israel. Name this politician from Plains, Georgia who lost his reelection campaign to Ronald Reagan.

Upon this legendary figure's death, his crown is passed to Constantine, and he is a member of the Nine Worthies. He discovered the Questing Beast and met King Pellinore, who was pursuing it. He received a mortal wound in battle at Camlann, where he killed his nephew, Mordred, before being taken to the isle of Avalon by Morgan le Fay. That battle arose over a conflict involving this man's wife and the knight Lancelot. Name this legendary British king who inhabited Camelot and wielded Excalibur, the husband of Guinevere and friend of Merlin.

This politician was recently reelected as speaker of the US House of Representatives. He was elected for the second time to server as speaker of the House after two Republicans changed their votes on the second ballot. He was born in Shreveport, Louisiana and served as a lawyer for a Christian advocacy group before being elected to the House of Representatives in 2016. Name this congressman from Louisiana who succeeded Mike McCarthy as speaker of the House.

This state's "six flags" include those of Spain and France. One of the worst disasters in U.S. history was the Galveston hurricane that hit this state in 1900. Stephen F. Austin was an early settler in this state. Name this state that George W. Bush was governor of before becoming president.

In one work by this author, Harry dies of gangrene in Africa. In addition to "The Snows of Kilimanjaro," this man wrote a novel in which Robert Cohn beats up Pedro Romero over Lady Brett Ashley, who is also loved by Jake Barnes. In one short story, Manolin comforts an aged fisherman after sharks eat that fisherman's huge marlin. Name this creator of Santiago and author of "The Sun Also Rises" and "The Old Man and the Sea."

Leydig cells may form benign tumors that emit this substance. Insects contain ecdysone which is similar to this chemical in humans. A deficiency of this hormone causes andropause. It reduces the risk for osteoporosis and is also used to treat prostate cancer, though can it be used as an anabolic steroid to increase muscle mass. Produced in the testes name this hormone responsible for male sex characteristics.

This film's haunting Russian roulette scenes, set against the backdrop of the Vietnam War, explore the psychological trauma and lasting impact of conflict on soldiers. The film's soundtrack features a memorable rendition of "Can't Take My Eyes Off You" sung by Frankie Valli, which becomes a recurring motif throughout the story. The film stars Robert De Niro, Christopher Walken, and Meryl Streep in a powerful ensemble cast. It won five Academy Awards, including Best Picture and Best Director for Michael Cimino. What is the title of this 1978 war drama?

This man was granted extra power through the "Enabling Act" after a Dutch Communist was blamed for arson, and he was earlier imprisoned for actions with Ludendorff which were inspired by the March on Rome. This participant of the "Beer Hall Putsch" wrote about taking "living space" from the Sudetenland before invading Poland on September 1, 1939. The author of Mein Kampf, name this Fuhrer and Chancellor of Nazi Germany.

The 2025 world championship of this sport was held at Alexandra Place in London, England. It was won by Luke Littler at age 17, who was the 2024 runner-up. The most common scoring system for this game uses a triple ring and a double ring, which multiply the segment's value when hit.  This game, often played in pubs and bars, involves throwing small pointed projectiles at a circular board with numbered segments. What is this game of skill and precision, popular in the United Kingdom and other countries?

A global seed vault is found on this country's island of Spitsbergen in the Svalbard archipelago, which is separated from this country's mainland by the Barents Sea. The Troll gas field is found offshore from this country, whose cities include Trondheim and Bergen. This country's western coast is indented by flooded valleys carved by glaciers called fjords, and it shares a long border with its eastern neighbor, Sweden. Name this Scandinavian country whose capital is Oslo.

Buddy Holly died in a plane crash near this state's Mason City. This state's highest point is located on a farm near the town of Sibley and is called Hawkeye Point. This state's exclave of Carter Lake lies on the west bank of the Missouri River on its border with Nebraska.
